entries.title: Pro Take: Private Credit Talent War Heats Up
entries.description: Wall Street firms are poaching private markets dealmakers from one another, in a bid to expand market share in the proliferating asset class.

entries.title: Nordic's Dual-Track Exit for Sunrise Medical Veered to Sale Amid Planned IPO
entries.description: European buyout shop Nordic Capital was focused on a public listing for portfolio company Sunrise Medical when an enticing option presented itself: Platinum Equity was ready to buy the German wheelchair maker outright.

entries.title: AI May Not Be What Sells Apple's Next iPhone
entries.description: Apple is expected to make AI the heart of the next iPhone, but pent-up demand following three weak years may be a bigger factor helping sales this time.

entries.title: SoftBank Corp. to Build Large-Scale AI Data Center in Osaka
entries.description: SoftBank Corp. plans to build a large-scale data center for artificial intelligence applications at Sharp Corp.’s Sakai plant in Osaka, Japan.

entries.title: GameStop Shares Rise Premarket on Roaring Kitty's YouTube Comeback
entries.description: GameStop shares continued to rise and were up almost 17% premarket after investor Keith Gill, also known as Roaring Kitty, said he would return to YouTube at noon Eastern time.

entries.title: Halfway Through an Epic Election Year, the Winner Is: Surprise
entries.description: From Mexico to India and South Africa, voters gave priority to their own economic prospects, delivering verdicts that ran counter to predictions.

entries.title: A Texas Stock Exchange Wants to Take on New York. The Odds Aren't Good.
entries.description: A red-blue divide underpins the TXSE’s challenge to the New York Stock Exchange and Nasdaq.

entries.title: It's a Buyer's Market for Boats, RVs and Other Pandemic Toys
entries.description: Sales of recreational items went from pandemic boom to inflationary bust. Some sellers were braced for the downturn.

entries.title: Drone Delivery's Next Challenge is How to Clear Cost Hurdles
entries.description: Airborne delivery tech is improving, but the economics of getting packages to homes must be solved for a wider rollout.

entries.title: Bonds, Currencies Seen Sensitive to Data; Euro Could Firm if U.S. Payrolls Weaken
entries.description: The ECB’s data-dependency guidance will certainly increase the sensitivity of bond and currency moves around key data releases, MUFG said, adding that whether the euro could test the $1.1000 level will likely depend on the U.S. jobs report.

entries.title: Could the Trump Tax Cuts Just Expire?
entries.description: With Trump administration tax cuts set to end after 2025, Democratic and Republican policymakers are prepping for a multitrillion-dollar stare-down.

entries.title: Norway's Nyhamna Gas Plant Resumes Exports After Repair
entries.description: Norway’s Nyhamna gas processing plant restarted exports on Friday after operations were unexpectedly shut down earlier this week, although the plant’s available capacity currently stands at 45 million cubic meters per day against total process...

entries.title: Gold Futures Trade Sideways Ahead of Key US Economic Data
entries.description: Gold futures continued to trade in a tight range ahead of U.S. nonfarm payrolls, with investors hoping the data will comes in weaker than expected, supporting the case the Fed will be able to start easing monetary policy sooner rather than later.

entries.title: Oil Set for Weekly Losses Despite Rebound on Rate Cut Hopes
entries.description: Oil prices were broadly stable in Europe but still on track for weekly losses after a selloff sparked by OPEC+’s decision to gradually bring some barrels back into the market later this year.

entries.title: Nvidia's Stock Split: What Investors Should Know
entries.description: Nvidia is splitting its stock 10-for-1 for investors who owned the stock as of the close of trading Thursday. Those shareholders will get nine additional shares for every share they own after the market closes on Friday. Trading on a split-adjusted...

entries.title: Jobs Report Expected to Show Hiring Growth
entries.description: Strong data could push back investor expectations for when the Federal Reserve might start cutting interest rates.

entries.title: Eurozone Periphery Bonds Look Attractive After ECB Rate Cut, Citi Says
entries.description: Holding long positions in eurozone peripheral government bonds looks an attractive way to bet on rising eurozone bond prices and falling yields during the summer after the ECB began cutting interest rates this week, Citi Research said.

entries.title: German Trade Surplus Narrows
entries.description: Germany’s adjusted trade surplus shrank to €22.1 billion in April as import growth outstripped exports, pointing to rising domestic demand.

entries.title: Ipsen Boosts Cancer Research With Marengo Partnership
entries.description: French pharmaceutical company Ipsen is expanding its oncology research partnership with Marengo Therapeutics and will pay the group up to $1.2 billion for the use of its TriSTAR platform.

entries.title: Gold Prices Are Sky-High. Will Gold Miners Follow?
entries.description: While gold prices are already 20% higher than a year ago, after a record-breaking rally, a benchmark gold-mining index is up by just half that.
